intro: Diascia purpurea, commonly known as the common diascia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Diascia purpurea is known for its long blooming period, often from spring to early autumn.
